texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: When I started  Thunderbird  today, it opened three windows. Each window was identical. I closed two of them and then quit Thunderbird.
texts.text: When I started  Thunderbird  today, it opened three windows. Each window was identical. I closed two of them and then quit Thunderbird.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: As soon as I started Thunderbird, I had  three windows again .
texts.text: As soon as I started Thunderbird, I had  three windows again .

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I found a  Mozilla bug report from 2015  that had some tips for getting the additional windows closed.
texts.text: I found a  Mozilla bug report from 2015  that had some tips for getting the additional windows closed.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Choose one of the open Thunderbird windows and select  Close  from the  File  menu.  Do not  use ALT-F4 or CTRL-W to close the window. Keep doing that until all of the windows are closed except for one. Then choose  Quit  from the hamburger menu drop down.
texts.text: Choose one of the open Thunderbird windows and select  Close  from the  File  menu.  Do not  use ALT-F4 or CTRL-W to close the window. Keep doing that until all of the windows are closed except for one. Then choose  Quit  from the hamburger menu drop down.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: At that point, start Thunderbird again and you should have only one open window.
texts.text: At that point, start Thunderbird again and you should have only one open window.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Note: You may find that one window does not respond to clicking  Close  - that's your root Thunderbird window and it cannot be closed. Be sure to close all of the others.
texts.text: Note: You may find that one window does not respond to clicking  Close  - that's your root Thunderbird window and it cannot be closed. Be sure to close all of the others.
